title: if someone goes past 0/15 it should flag their account
body:
i'm not saying instaban, i'm saying *flag* their account to at least have someone look at it.

just had a player who went 0/16/2, refused to group, ran it down multiple times without using abilities

you *cannot* tell me that they weren't trolling. there was 0 communication and *NO ONE FLAMED THEM*

rarely do games last long enough to get 15 deaths, and even when they do generally everyone on the team has multiple kills.

(edit) i'm mainly referring to *ranked* games, not games where there are new players or people playing new things.

(new edit) instead of personally replying to each comment that is saying the same thing (what about supports going 0/15/? and a ton of assists) 

how many games do you ever see a support die that many times? lets be real here, it's not many, and if it happens even a few times nothing would happen to them as long as it wasn't because they were inting. i think it's safe to say that at least half of leagues toxicity problem

replies.body: 15 deaths is hard to get? you must not play iron league solo queue.

Thats because the Tribunal was used for all cases, including chat. The IFS already handles chat, so the Tribunal would be much more efficient now as it would only be needed for trolling/inting.

The last time Riot talked about bringing the Tribunal back, they mentioned the idea of having known good behavior games sprinkled in, to help weed out people doing just what you described.
That wasn't my experience as someone who had 100% accuracy and almost as many pardons as punishments.  If this was true I would not have had anywhere close to 100% majority accuracy.
and just like a jury, it could take months before an agreement would be made

> [{quoted}](name=Voldymort,realm=EUNE,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=AnKKjbN0,comment-id=000200000001,timestamp=2019-02-27T07:31:47.864+0000)
>
> and just like a jury, it could take months before an agreement would be made

the old tribunal system was a good idea that needed more work to get more people to use it.  now that riot is starting to reward good behavior maybe they could reward people who use the tribunal and make good judgments on cases.  the boards community compared to the rest of the league community who doesn't use boards is *very* small. i have many friends and met many people who didn't even know about the boards. but i think most of the boards would use a new tribunal if one was put out.

if the number of people using the tribunal was the only issue, i'd wager that riot would try to improve that problem or attempt to draw more people in, instead of removing it altogether. but the fact of the matter is that the tribunal also produced many false positives that needed to be manually reviewed and redone.

by comparison, the ifs's margin of error is much much smaller

I once went 0/18 as ADC in a PvP match that lasted for 50 minutes. I was trying really hard to be useful to my team, but the enemy consistently focused me. I'm glad I wasn't banned for being bad at the game.
This scenario is super rare and not the norm. That's why it's supposed to be flagged and not instabanned.

what do you mean super rare

tower diving is actually endorsed by riot, to the point that they specifically "compensated" akali on her rework to be able to "tower dive just as well as the other assassins" with true stealth. It's stupid, it's horrible, no one likes it but that's just how the meta has degraded over the years.

you are expected to be killed regardless of where you are on the map without exception, including under your own tower at full health.
It's 2019, there is no safe zone or safe laning.

and camping a lane is extremely commonplace, it's literally the only thing about jungling riot has never nerfed and actually buffed with CS bounties

If there is a minimum amount of deaths such as 0/15, it's highly unlikely you get there without trolling.
Often the enemy dies to the tower or you play safe enough so you wont die this many times.
I mean.. when was the last time you even went double digits deaths with 0 kills?

> [{quoted}](name=KFCeytron,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=AnKKjbN0,comment-id=0005,timestamp=2019-02-27T05:20:53.351+0000)
>
> I once went 0/18 as ADC in a PvP match that lasted for 50 minutes. I was trying really hard to be useful to my team, but the enemy consistently focused me. I'm glad I wasn't banned for being bad at the game.

This is precisely what makes OP's Post a bad idea.
Riot can tell if people are 0-18 and trying or 0-18 and trolling. Riot can already see everything that happens ingame. This includes mouse click locations, keyboard button usage, ping, ms, click rate, screen pan patterns etc etc.

Even if someone reported you and got your account looked at by the system, all the data of you trying to play counts towards revealing that report as false
But the players "raging" at the 0-18 player will get banned way before the 0-18 player will even be looked at.
Hold on they track your whole keyboard? Or just your commands used
If that happens in a normal game, it's ok. You can be a first timer etc. If this happens in a ranked game, then it's not ok, because if you are a first timer, you shouldn't be playing ranked.

>you generally don't only have 2 assists and 16 deaths unless you're inting.

generally =/= without exception
Then fix the exceptions instead of letting the majority go. The vast, VAST majority of the time if someone is 0/16/2 they are trolling or inting
the only way to "fix the exceptions" is to ban all of them at face value and expect tickets to sort out the true and false. And it doesn't seem fair.

I've had 0/X/20-30 games as Janna before.

Granted, in games like that I usually have fewer than 5 deaths, but the point is it's possible to get a fuckload of assists without getting a single kill.

I once did nasus support and went something like 0/11/45 or something like that. Sorry I did over exaggerate the assists lol, but I know it was hella high.

Some people would think I was trolling or inting because I was nasus, but I did check with my team before I picked and they were fine with the pick. I was in that phase where you would play one champ no matter what and in any position. And this was a normal game. I went ap poke supp and my lane won hard lol, I did die a lot but I usually got my adc or another teammate 1 kill or more from each fight.
I actually got the idea when Trick did AP nasus supp but I went more supp than poke.

There was also my first game as jinx this past weekend where I died a lot. The enemy lulu and QUinn got such a good early lead that I was dead if I walked anywhere. Quinn could easily one shot me and Swain was an absolute beast lol. I was very clearly trying to win but my Fiora was so tilted that she was convinced that I was intentionally feeding and she called me out on that. I denied it and my team backed me up but she still asked for people to report me, I told her that asking for reports is bannable and I also explained that this was my very first game on jinx and that it was natural for somebody to do poorly on a new champ. We said most of that stuff in all chat and the enemy team was very kind and backed me up (the swain was streaming on twitch lol) Andre lost in relative peace after the Fiora kinda stopped. I still reported her and sent friend requests to the people on the enemy team, I joined them, we won a few more games and had a lot of fun. I did play jinx again that night but I did really well and we stomped the enemy team, but I did miss most of my ults lol.
They start doing this, I start leaving games if I go 0/14.
